reviews.text: Truly mediocre food across the street from Lincoln center. This is not where you should be eating in NYC
They ran out of burgers after the NY marathon, so i "settled" for the calamari. It was excellent.
Iâ€™ve been to The Smith plenty of times â€” foodâ€™s always great, the vibeâ€™s nice, and the service is solid. It can get a little busy sometimes, but always worth the wait.

The Smith is amazing! I had a latte and the eggs Benedict, and both were absolutely delicious. The staff are so sweet and incredibly attentive, making the whole experience feel warm and welcoming. Plus, the location, right near Lincoln Center, makes it the perfect spot for brunch before a show or a stroll through the city. Highly recommend!
Our waiter was awesome!!!

Such a great food and excellent service. Their calamari and truffle fries are just mind blowing.  And make sure try their mimosas, so good! ğŸ¥‚ It was also my bday and our wonderful waitress served me a peace of absolutely delicious chocolate cake a-la Black Forest.

Updated (11/27/25): I was told to reach out to a Jennifer Woodhull about my experience and although she seemed to care and offered a gift card to make up for the bad experiences thatâ€™s been occurring at The Smith, it was all for show. Itâ€™s been over a week a no reply nor any gift card. Changed my review from a 2 to a 1 due to this disrespect and horrible customer service.

I used to love this place and would come pretty often, but lately itâ€™s just not the same. The food still tastes good, Iâ€™ll give them that, but everything else has taken a hit.

Me and my fiancÃ©e ordered our usual: two Smith burgers and calamari. The calamari portion was super small, like an appetizer for one, which was disappointing. The burgers were flavorful like always, but the buns were dry and hard, definitely not fresh. It kind of killed the whole thing.

What really did it for me, though, was the service. The staff came off kind of rude, and the manager was nowhere to be found when we needed help. He eventually came by and tried to assist, but by then we were already over it. We just wanted to leave.

After years of being a loyal customer, I think this might be it for me. It sucks because this used to be my go-to spot. Now I guess Iâ€™m on the hunt for a new burger place.
Good was delicious, service was terrible

Three of us met for dinner before going to Lincoln Center for an 8pm performance. I was early and watched the restaurant fill up while sitting at the bar. When my friends arrived, we were taken to our seats in another very large room. Our servers must have been new as they were reaching over us to place our plates. Food arrived cold. Instructions were ignored and food had to be sent back.
As the room filled up, it was harder to hear.
The restaurant gets high marks for its location. We had just a short walk to the theater.  The food was good when they finally got it right.
The atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was attentive without being intrusive.
When Iâ€™m in need of a solid steak, I come here and itâ€™s good every time, kitchen is open late and you can eat at the bar!
Delicious food and great service. Definitely coming back!!

We come to NYC once or twice a year and always take a night to go to The Smith. Weâ€™ve been to several locations, but our fav is the one at Lincoln Center. In our latest visit there, Cat was our server and she was so kind and personable that it made our experience way above and beyond. She was THE BEST. We even made sure the manager knew how great she was! It was a lively restaurant, more so than the other weâ€™d been to, but it was not overly loud or obnoxious. It was a terrific experience. You will love it!! Weâ€™ll definitely make it one of our destinations for future visits!
Ğ‘ÑƒĞ´Ñƒ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ñ ÑĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ÑƒĞ´Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸.

I had high hopes for this restaurant, but unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the worst experiences of my entire trip to New York.
The main issue was the overwhelming noise level throughout our meal. The restaurant was so loud that my companion and I couldnâ€™t have a proper conversation. Every attempt to communicate was drowned out by the constant commotion around us.
The seating arrangement was extremely poor. We were placed just twenty centimeters away from the adjacent table, leaving us with virtually no personal space. Even worse, my companionâ€™s seat was positioned so close to the table that she had difficulty getting out of her chairâ€”the table was practically wedged against the seat.
During our forty-minute dinner, we had to endure constant noise from the kitchen area and an employee cleaning silverware just three meters away from our table. The clattering of dishes being washed and plates repeatedly falling to the floor created a relentless backdrop of noise and disruption that made dining nearly impossible.
While the food deserves credit for being decent (2/5), it simply couldnâ€™t compensate for the overall terrible atmosphere and lack of consideration for customer comfort. I would not recommend this restaurant and advise future visitors to look elsewhere for a more pleasant dining experience.
Servicio muy agradable, y la comida estaba bastante buena.
Molto buono!
We ate outside.  It was delightful.
Delicious food! If the weather is nice, definitely choose an outdoor table! ğŸ‘Œ
I love this place I only wish they had an earlier dinner, I donâ€™t want to be eating pancakes at 4pm guys this is not normal. Also you do the oysters for brunch but not the mussels ?
Very nice environment and food. The service is nice and waitressed are so kind. Amazing butter panckae

We had a reservation for five people, including a two-year-old, for brunch at The Smith on Saturday (10/11) at 11:30 a.m. We arrived on time, checked in with the hostess, LILY, and mentioned we needed a high chair.

Unfortunately, our experience started off poorly. LILY ignored us right after check-in and turned to chat with another hostess instead. A little later, she briefly told us to wait â€œa minute or two,â€ but we ended up waiting almost 30 minutes while watching her seat several groups who arrived after us.

By noon, our toddler was getting very hungry, so I asked another hostess for help. She checked the system and asked whether we had checked in, I told her we had, with LILY, and had already been waiting for nearly half an hour. Thankfully, a gentleman with glasses noticed the situation and kindly seated us right away. LILY stood nearby and acted as if nothing had happened.

The whole experience felt dismissive and disrespectful, honestly, it came across as racial discrimination. It completely ruined what should have been a pleasant brunch. I really hope the management takes this seriously and looks into how their front desk staff treats guests.
We love walking here for Brunch on Sundays. Staff very friendly. Great comfort food with a little twist.

Love the Smith. This is one of my favorite locations. The cocktails are great and the food is amazing. I enjoy sitting outside and seeing Lincoln Center across the street and people watching. The mussels and fries is probably my favorite. And they have sticky toffee pudding ALL YEAR LONG!

âš ï¸ WARNING âš ï¸ â€” The Smith is racist. If youâ€™re Black, especially dark-skinned, donâ€™t expect to be a server. They will make you a busser while white people run the floor. I went to three locations, and every time it was the same.

When I asked why, they told me â€œthe dark skin image isnâ€™t a thing.â€ Really? Thatâ€™s your excuse for discriminating? Newsflash: it is a thing, and itâ€™s happening every day at your restaurants.

This isnâ€™t just about me â€” itâ€™s about fairness and respect. Donâ€™t support a place that decides your role based on skin color. Spread the word.

The food is consistently delicious. The best place to dine at around Lincoln Center and AMC theatre. Paige was our server and she was so friendly and attentive. This is our go to spot on movie nights!

I was literally shocked to see the steak cooked to PERFECTION! The staff were kind and fulfilled my request without any issues! I come here regularly! Their food and drinks are top notch! I HIGHLY recommend coming here! 10/10
Jay is such a charismatic server and made my birthday perfect! Ive actually come here every year for my birthday and have always had a perfect time. if you live in nyc, its a staple

Exactly across the street from Lincoln Center and in the heart of the Upper West Side, The Smith is filled with everyone from pre- and post-theatergoers to neighborhood families to global travelers, where my partner and I decided on brunch last Saturday. The reservation was easily made with OpenTable.

Each location of this establishment boasts a unique ambiance, blending modern design with classic elements - a nod to old-school New York.

Upon entering, the interior is characterized by open layouts, communal tables, and a lively atmosphere, making it suitable for everyone. We were greeted by the host and got a table in a private room usually held for special events.

Their menu features a variety of classic American dishes, emphasizing fresh, locally sourced ingredients.

As an appetizer, we opted for the Mac & Cheese and Crispy Calamari. As a main meal, we decided on Avocado Toast and a French Dip Sandwich accompanied by Fries. Complimentary sourdough bread with salted butter and one bottle of spring water and one of sparkling water started our meal.

The Mac and Cheese served in a mini skillet was phenomenal. The cheese was dripping, and the noodles were perfectly chewy, with the top having that crust, too. The food was fresh, well-prepared, and perfectly portioned. The cost didnâ€™t break the wallet. We had the pleasure of having Adonis as our server, and the service was quick. He was fantastic and would check on us.

This place provides satisfaction.

I wanted to bring up a concern from my recent visit to The Smith. I ordered the Chappellet Signature Cabernet Sauvignon listed on your menu at $165. The server explained there was a â€œyear difference,â€ but what was actually brought was the Chappellet Mountain CuvÃ©e â€” a completely different wine at a much lower tier and price point.

I asked them to discount it at least but my server insisted the price was firm after asking the manager. A $40 bottle should have been $100-120 tops. I still left a nice cash tip to not embarrass the waitress more than necessary.

Iâ€™m sure you understand how this feels misleading, especially at a premium price level. If the Signature was unavailable, transparency would have been appreciated so I could make an informed choice rather than being served a different product under the assumption it was equivalent.
Sadly this place has gone downhill. Seems like cost cutting has destroyed the menu. Service was great, food is way worse than it was 5 years ago.

Made a last-minute reservation, and as always, this place was great. They had a nice booth ready for us, and the service was excellentâ€”I've been here several times now, and they never disappoint. Our server was amazing (they always are at The Smith).

There are food options for everyone, and the price point is very reasonable for NYC. My only wish is that they had a few more coffee options, but they do have the basics.
Great food. Price. But bit noisy.
Amazing place and great service
The menu is great because of a wonderful variety of choices. I had the best sushi there that Iâ€™ve ever had before. Loud and fun place!
The food is good, the server is nice and friendly and the food is delicious
Almost no service. Good was good. Cool hidden dining room
Tile walls result in low space but if you don't mind that the food is consistently good.
I've never before received such thoughtful service while dining. The team is amazing! Coming across this spot was fortunate! The food stands above competitors. This place provides satisfaction.

The only thing I miss about New York!

Update: a big thanks to Monica this weekend, we had the best brunch as usual!

â€œThe Smith has a wonderful vibe with a lively atmosphere and stylish decor. The food is tasty and well-presented, though sometimes the portions feel a bit small for the price. Service is generally friendly and attentive, but it can get aâ€¦

I loved the Mac and cheese and the hamburger! We also ordered the shrimp pasta and it was still good but not my favorite (sorry Iâ€™m Italian and very picky with pasta)
Overall a cute restaurant with a nice vibe
Attentive staff. Large restaurant with ample seating in and outside.

Given this place the benefit of the doubt since itâ€™s in the neighborhood. Time and time again.

The Bartenders seemed to be bothered when you sit down to have food or a drink. The lack of effort to greet you, hand a menu over or even come by to acknowledge your presence (which is both when the place is empty and busy)

Management should actually watch this happen. Itâ€™s real. Imagine this place stays on Broadway due to it being a franchise and the tourist that Lincoln center attracts.

As for the neighborhood, I would suggest you support other local establishments.
Decent American food, pricy but tasty and well served. Nice location and atmosphere

I went there on a Monday evening and they were pretty busy on a week night. So I suggest making a reservation. The spicy shrimp scampi that I ordered didnâ€™t look like what I thought as I expected it to be red but it turned out to be not bad.
Always delicious, quality food and excellent service.

Looking for a standout in the Lincoln Center area? The Smith may just be the answer to your problem. We had a reservation for breakfast and Iâ€™m glad we did cause despite arriving at opening, seats began quickly getting filled here. The interior is great, a nod to old school New York. The outside, where we sat, was nice as well. They were very accommodating of our dog by bringing him a water bowl and the outdoor dining area is well staffed. The service is good too. We ordered pretty quick and the food also came out quick as well. Hereâ€™s how the food was:

We started off with a mac and cheese, which may sound crazy but man was it the right decision. The mac and cheese was phenomenal, cheese dripping and noodles perfectly chewy. The top had that crust too, just great. We also ordered the french toast and it was good as well. The bread was thick and soft, the caramelized bananas were a bit sweet though so we ate it without to balance out the flavor. The Benedict Johnny was good, the cornbread sweet and savory.The chicken sausage was good and the poached egg added a good texture to things and a bit more flavor. We also grabbed a cappuccino that was frothy and well made. The food altogether was very good and we were happily surprised with the quality of everything. Even though it was on the pricier side of things, we would definitely come back if weâ€™re ever in the area.

Brisk and bustling location near Lincoln center and Columbus circle.  Options to sit at bar, outside, front and back dining rooms.  Expect a lot of children and noise. Food wise, typical bistro style food.  The Smith steak had very tasty peppercorn sauce and spinach was not hammered.  Portions on the small side but drinks are excellent.   Reservation a must

Stopped by The Smith on a Tuesday during lunch hour, surprisingly lively but still had available tables. The place was spotless, well-organized, and had a welcoming vibe from the moment I walked in.

Every staff member I encountered, from the host to the lovely server Joyce, was genuinely warm and attentive. The food was fresh, well-prepared, and perfect for a quick but satisfying bite. Even the small touches like clean utensils and fresh garnishes ...  all stood out.

Itâ€™s a great go-to spot for a casual lunch, conveniently located right across from Lincoln Center. Whether you're catching a matinee or just in the area, The Smith hits all the right notes.

[i went last year in 2024, but just posting this now]

We chose outdoor seating on a drizzly summer night. The location was nice, there were still people walking around and cars driving by at 10pm on a Friday night.

The sticky toffee pudding was amazing I would come back just for the pudding!!

The peppers were too salty (and greasy) for me at times, it was a hit or miss. I didn't try the salmon, but my boyfriend said it was "not bad." Overall food was meh until we got to the pudding.

Honestly a great experience with Kristine, she was my server today, she gave me a great experience with my girlfriend. I would come again for the Hot chocolate, and the sticky toffee pudding, she was great and honestly just amazing experience. I hope someone gives her props for being a great server!!!! I will definitely be coming back here again

My husband and I took a spontaneous trip to New York with no plans as to where to eat, what we would do, etc, and we landed here for dinner and boy did we luck out! The food was incredible, we had the calamari, arancini, and their potato chips with blue cheese fondue, all of which were spectacular! We had the pleasure of having Justin R as our server, he was fantastic and recommended a wonderful cocktail, the Cucumber Loco (tequila drink). Finally, we happened to get a chance to try the apple tart for dessert and wow! I am not normally a dessert person but this was fantastic. Hands down we would come back again next time we visit the city. The restaurant, the food, the staff and the atmosphere were all amazing!

I'm so glad we came here for lunch on our anniversary on July 15th. This was by far the best restaurant we've been to in New York City. We over-ordered a bit, but it was worth it.

Because we had a reservation, there was no wait time. The server (wish I recalled his name, our check number was #100), was superb. He checked on us often and made us feel appreciated and valued (unlike our experience at Lucali the day prior).

We started with the shrimp cocktail ($19 but so worth it) and a new Chips and Dip item they apparently just added to the menu. A small side of veggies came with the appetizers.

I went boujee with my drink order and had the Lunch IPA from Maine Beer Company, hey, we were celebrating 25 years. :)

My wife ordered a salad and I had the French Dip, both were absolutely delicious and perfect-portioned. I ordered a shot of espresso to combat the food comma I was in. To our surprise, the manager comp'd a delicious pudding dessert with a candle on it, apparently something they are well-known for - it was AWESOME! I'm not a huge pudding fan (I'm a chocoholic), but I'll definitely order that again when we visit again.

Over all, our experience was the perfect 25th Anniversary lunch that we'll remember forever.

We came here for brunch today. It wasnâ€™t our first time dining hereâ€”weâ€™ve had The Smith burger before, and since we were in the mood for a burger again, we decided to come back.
We know the burger portions are huge, and it comes with either French fries or a salad. We usually go for the friesâ€”they're perfectly crispy, and they give you a generous portion. The burger was delicious as always. We ordered the meat medium-rare, and it was just rightâ€”juicy and flavorful. My boyfriend found it a bit salty, but I actually like it that way, so I wasnâ€™t disappointed.
We skipped appetizers but couldnâ€™t resist dessert. We originally wanted to get their sâ€™mores in a jar, as usual, but unfortunately, it wasnâ€™t on the menu today. Instead, we went with the buttermilk pancakes, which were absolutely deliciousâ€”fluffy and not overly sweet. The pecan maple butter was the perfect touch. If you ever see the sâ€™mores on the menu, Iâ€™d highly recommend trying them!
For drinks, we each had a beer with our burgers and coffee with pancakesâ€”everything was satisfying.
Service was good and fast; they brought out bottles of still and sparkling water right away.
The ambiance is okay, but the only downside was the noise level. It was so loud that I could barely hear our waitress, and it was tough to have a conversation.

We visited one of the several The Smith restaurant locations at Lincoln Square. It was middle of the week, Wednesday, somewhere before 6pm. It already was filled with customers but we got lucky to have a table without any waiting. Casual atmosphere was very inviting and friendly. And in one hour the place was fully packed. The menu list done in dark color with tiny little white letters and it made me hard to read it. A helpful server gave us some suggestions and we picked up BLUE CHEESE WEDGE and BLACK TRUFFLE ARANCINI as starters and DUCK FRITES for main dish offered as a special on Wednesday. Table gets one bottle of spring and one of sparkling water and 2 pieces of freshly baked sourdough bread with salted butter as a complement which is nice. This order was more than enough for two people. The salad was sprinkled with a lot of sliced onions, lacking sauce and was not really enjoyable. ARANCINI was made from a delicious risotto, formed as fried balls, had creamy and cheesy consistency with the crunchy crust on the top with very flavorful sauce.  We loved them. DUCK FRITES were two duck thighs cooked until tender and served with rich creamy white sauce and I believe which had a horseradish notes in it. The duck was coming with nicely done fries. Cut the piece of duck, deep in the sauce and you will enjoy it until the last bite. If it will happen to dine on Wednesday I highly recommend you to try this great entire.
Be aware that the tables inside the restaurant are located very close to each other and conversations among the guests creates a lot of noise so if you are looking for more intimacy maybe this place is not a good fit.
Overall it was a great experience, tasty dinner and Iâ€™m definitely coming back.

What a great dining experience on our last night of vacation in NYC! We went in just before 5pm on a Sunday. It looked super busy, so we weren't sure if we would get in, but we were seated right away. Our waiter, Travis, was fantastic! So friendly and attentive. Actually, the entire staff was attentive! When our water bottle was empty, it was immediately refilled. Travis let us know when our food order was put in with the kitchen, and we didn't wait long at all. Go on Sunday and get the chicken parm special! You will not regret it! It tasted amazing, was cooked perfectly, and was absolutely worth the 5-Star review. I highly recommend!!

This restaurant, located right in front of Lincoln Center, is always busy with lots of customers.

The food is reasonably good, and the atmosphere is pleasant enough.

I had the chance to experience their Thanksgiving Day menu. While the price was higher due to the special occasion, every dish was delicious and perfectly suited for the holiday. I visited with a guest, and it felt like a great choice to provide a memorable dining experience.

Had such an amazing time here! Genesis was our waitress and she was fantastic! Was so patient and kind, even though I took forever to order. We got the smith burger and chimichurri steak and both were absolutely delicious!! Highly recommend! We will definitely be back next time we are in NY!!

On another beautiful evening in NYC we decided to dine outside at The Smith. It was a great choice as we were treated so well and enjoyed excellent food. We started with two wonderful appetizers the roasted tomato soup and black truffle arancini. We then moved on to the steak and The Smith Burger. Both were prepared to our liking and the French fries and roasted squash sides were satisfying. We finished with the very tasty sticky toffee pudding and apple tart. Yes it was a good night at The Smith.

Take arancini -  risotto with mozzarella and tell me thank you later:)) rib pasta is delicious as well
The interior is great, the service is extra attentive
The dinner was great, but even half of the tables were empty - it was too loud to speak:((

The food was delicious, with unique recipes that made each dish stand out. The cozy, lively vibe added to the experience, and the friendly wait staff ensured we felt welcome. Service was quick, making it an ideal spot for a great meal without the wait.

Very busy spot. Food was good as was service.  We had lunch/brunch.  Was particularly interested in the jalapeÃ±o cheddar grits. They definitely had a hint of smoky pepper taste, but were a little gummy.     Snap pea salad was very good and shrimp were cooked well. Burger was good and fries were nice and crispy. Overall a solid restaurant with a large menu. Will definitely return to try some more items.

A restaurant where you can enjoy American style specialties like French Toast, Pancakes and any kind of eggs. The flavor of the food is acceptable but nothing to write home about. The waitstaff on the contrary are very friendly and helpful.

Massive Restaurant! I didnâ€™t think we would be getting seating after we went to see the Nutcracker at Lincoln Center - right across the way- but there was a whole back area and we were seated within 3-5 mins with a packed house! We had some drinks, the calamari was outstanding, I loved the selections for oysters and the entrees were also very delicious! Would highly recommend and plan to go back!

Thorough enjoyed our meals and the busy vibe at The Smith. Conveniently located directly across the street from Lincoln Center and The Metropolitan Opera, it was the perfect spot to hit before our concert. The wait staff were superb, The short rib pasta, the chicken milanese, and sticky toffee pudding were excellent. Nice drink menu and wine list as well. Can't wait to go back! Make a reservation!
